metadata.title: CVE-2019-3460 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap data infoleak in multiple locations including L2CAP_PARSE_CONF_RSPwas found in the Linux kernel before 5.1-rc1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3460` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-47-generic - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-4.15.0-47-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-4.15.0-47-lowlatency - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-4.15.0-47-snapdragon - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-47-generic - 4.15.0-47.50
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-47-lowlatency - 4.15.0-47.50
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1033-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1033.35
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1053-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1053.57
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1035-aws - 4.15.0-1035.37
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-17-generic - 4.18.0-17.18~18.04.1
